channel.title: NETGEAR router
channel.description:
:( okay so im trying to create a server.... i have got no-ip running and it says my server (d33jscape) is running... i have downloaded a client and source (pwnscape) havent looked about trying to change the server ip to mine yet tho... i have logged onto my router... a netgear router and not found where to add a defined application.... i went on "firewall rules" and added a new outbound service etc... but i dont think i can log onto my server... any help???
msn's will be appreciated so i can send screenies of whats going on....
thanks in advance... djmorgan92

item.title: NETGEAR router
item.dc:creator: @adventurescape adventurescape
item.description:
@adventurescape wrote:

[quote=“fredfredh, post:10, topic:279205”]how come my server doesnt let eney 1 ele log in :S[/quote]because only the main owner and coder (you) can login a false (local ip) ip. if u cant make a regular server, just download hamachi, make a network, tell people to join ur network, then tell them ur hamachi ip then they could login because hamachi is a kind of host for people to join

Read full topic

item.title: NETGEAR router
item.dc:creator: @Menno582 Menno582
item.description:
@Menno582 wrote:

Netgear

Go to: 192.168.1.1. Scroll down to Portforwarding/Porttriggering
In the first box fill in your server name, put in Start Port: 43594, also put 43594 in End Port.
By finishing it will look like this: 192.168.1.2.

100% Credits to Mubbly for the above TuT

Read full topic

item.title: NETGEAR router
item.dc:creator: @ledgman ledgman
item.description:
@ledgman wrote:

You dont need no-ip running for you to be able to log in and also you only portforward for other to get onto your server, so if your not portforwarded, that won’t stop you logging into your own server.

Read full topic

item.title: NETGEAR router
item.dc:creator: @djmorgan92 djmorgan92
item.description:
@djmorgan92 wrote:

okay so i have pwnscape source/client downloaded and im running both… my no-ip is running and it says my server ip is ok… but it just wont let me log in… i have done all steps in the sould guide to making a server apart from when i log onto my router i dont see any options on making a new application definition so i have trieda few things and added an outbound service which all looks ok but maybe im not portfowarding correctly… could any1 add me on msn so i can send screenys… morgan_92@hotmail.com

thanks

Read full topic

item.title: NETGEAR router
item.dc:creator: @ledgman ledgman
item.description:
@ledgman wrote:

Pwnscape should be set to log into 127.0.0.1 anyways, so just run the server by clicking run.bat and run the client aswell.

You should log in.

Read full topic

item.title: NETGEAR router
item.dc:creator: @djmorgan92 djmorgan92
item.description:
@djmorgan92 wrote:

ok im confused… how do i set the pwnscape to run to my server ip and not the one i downloaded it with???

Read full topic

item.title: NETGEAR router
item.dc:creator: @ledgman ledgman
item.description:
@ledgman wrote:

Or 127.0.0.1, remember to make sure your client is set to connect to 127.0.0.1.

DONT change the ip on the server files. leave that.

Make sure you have your server running first, then log into.

Read full topic
